cleaned_text: Senior Associate Scientist - Scientist - HT Plasmid Production - Vaccine Senior Associate Scientist - Scientist - HT Plasmid Production - Vaccine The Senior Associate Scientist/Scientist will be part of the High-Throughput Plasmid Production team carrying out routine DNA analytics tasks and developing automation method development to deliver high quality DNA products for High-Throughput In-vitro Transcription work. Key Responsibilities: Routinely support high-throughput DNA (HT-DNA) team with DNA analytics, track, and log details in Benchling. Actively support all the high-throughput deliverable projects as needed. Work with Scientists and Automation engineers to develop and validate new methods on HT instruments. Independently operate HT instruments such as Hamilton Vantage, QPix, Fragment Analyzer, KingFisher etc. Independently document experiments, analyze data, write experiment reports, and present findings and conclusion in professional setting. Follow SOP precisely and reliably to generate DNA templates for in-vitro transcription work as needed. Work with HT-DNA team members to manage, track and order lab supplies on a regular basis. Prepare technical reports, presentations, and recommendations to management and other stakeholders. Experience with LIMS, maintain accurate tracking and documentation in Benchling electronic notebook. Be a collaborative team player with a strong work ethic and able to follow verbal instructions clearly. Ability to multi-task without making mistakes and finish projects within given timeline. The individual should be able to function in a timeline driven, dynamic environment and be able to follow instructions in SOPs and adapt to the changes in protocols and projects quickly. This is a lab-based position requires standing and hands-on during regular working hours. Qualification: BS or MS in Genetics, Biotechnology, Molecular Biology, Biomedical Engineering or related fields with more than 3 years of relevant industry or academic experience or PhD with less than one year postdoc experience (please add as per Sanofi requirement) Experience with liquid handlers is required. Experience with high-throughput DNA analytics - DNA concentration measurement using UV/Vis absorbance spectrometer, DNA integrity test via Fragment analyzer, DNA sequencing via NGS or Sanger sequencing. Ideal candidate will possess a deep understanding of molecular cloning techniques (restriction digestion based cloning, Gibson Assembly, Hi-Fi Assembly, In-Fusion cloning) Hands-on experience with a range of molecular biology techniques - PCR, agarose gel electrophoresis, nucleic acid purification, sequencing etc. Experience in using molecular biology software such as Geneious is a must. Must be well organized, self-motivated, proactive, work well under pressure and deadlines and detail oriented. Ability to multi-task and coordinate work on several simultaneous projects. Ability to collaborate effectively both within and across teams. Must be a team player.
